header: CNR No.MHPU01­000844­2019 Hemant Kantilal Dodiya Vs. State of Maharashtra ( Market Yard Police Station )

background.text: Order below exh. 1 in Cri. Bail application No.223/2019 1. This is an application U/s.439 of Cr.P.C. filed by the applicant­accused for grant of bail in connection with Crime No. 14/2019 , registered with Market Yard Police Station for the offence punishable u/s.188, 272, 273, 328 of the IPC and 59 of Food and Drug Safety Standard Act.

arguments.text: 2. Prosecution case is that on 08/01/2019, as per information received to Market Yard Police Station, P. I. Shri. Satav carried raid on Panshop of applicant/accused, at that time, it is disclosed that the applicant/accused was having in possession contraband articles ­Gutka etc., therefore, offence was registered, therefore, offence registered against him.

argumentSentences.text: Prosecution case is that on 08/01/2019, as per information received to Market Yard Police Station, P. I. Shri.

Satav carried raid on Panshop of applicant/accused, at that time, it is disclosed that the applicant/accused was having in possession contraband articles ­Gutka etc., therefore, offence was registered, therefore, offence registered against him.

arguments.text: 3. Learned counsel for applicant/accused submitted that applicant/accused has not committed any offence, he has been falsely implicated in this offence. He further submitted that custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary, therefore, he be released on bail.

argumentSentences.text: Learned counsel for applicant/accused submitted that applicant/accused has not committed any offence, he has been falsely implicated in this offence.
He further submitted that custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary, therefore, he be released on bail.

arguments.text: 4. On the other hand, learned APP submitted that if applicant/accused is released on bail, there is possibility of tampering the prosecution evidence. He further submitted that investigation is yet to be completed, therefore, application be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: On the other hand, learned APP submitted that if applicant/accused is released on bail, there is possibility of tampering the prosecution evidence.
He further submitted that investigation is yet to be completed, therefore, application be rejected.

arguments.text: 5. On perusing police papers, prima facie, it reveals that on 08/01/2019, Market Yard Police have carried raid on Panshop of applicant/accused, at that time, applicant/accused was found in possession of Gutka and other contraband articles i.e. tobacco. It 2 appears that as the contraband articles are seized, therefore, custodial interrogation of applicant/accused is not necessary. Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­ accused is released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution. Hence, I pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: On perusing police papers, prima facie, it reveals that on 08/01/2019, Market Yard Police have carried raid on Panshop of applicant/accused, at that time, applicant/accused was found in possession of Gutka and other contraband articles i.e. tobacco.
It 2 appears that as the contraband articles are seized, therefore, custodial interrogation of applicant/accused is not necessary.
Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­ accused is released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution.
Hence, I pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER i. Application is allowed. ii. The applicant ­accused­ Hemant Kantilal Dodiya be released on bail on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty five Thousand Only) with one or two solvent sureties in like amount. iii. The applicant­ accused shall not tamper with prosecution evidence. iv. The applicant ­accused shall attend concerned Police Station on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­sheet. v. The applicant­ accused shall not leave Pune District without prior permission of this Court, till final disposal of the case. vi. The applicant­ accused shall furnish fresh residential address to concerned Police Station and to this Court in case he changed present address. vii. The applicant ­accused shall attend the court regularly till final disposal of the case.

footer: Date : 21/01/2019 (K.D.Vadane) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. 3 “I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Order are same word to word as per original judgment.” Name of Steno : Shri S. B. processedText:
CNR No.MHPU01­000844­2019 Hemant Kantilal Dodiya Vs. State of Maharashtra ( Market Yard Police Station ) 
---header-ends---
Order below exh. 1 in Cri. Bail application No.223/2019 1. This is an application U/s.439 of Cr.P.C. filed by the applicant­accused for grant of bail in connection with Crime No. 14/2019 , registered with Market Yard Police Station for the offence punishable u/s.188, 272, 273, 328 of the IPC and 59 of Food and Drug Safety Standard Act. 
---background-ends---
2. Prosecution case is that on 08/01/2019, as per information received to Market Yard Police Station, P. I. Shri. Satav carried raid on Panshop of applicant/accused, at that time, it is disclosed that the applicant/accused was having in possession contraband articles ­Gutka etc., therefore, offence was registered, therefore, offence registered against him.
---argument-ends---
3. Learned counsel for applicant/accused submitted that applicant/accused has not committed any offence, he has been falsely implicated in this offence. He further submitted that custodial interrogation of the applicant/accused is not necessary, therefore, he be released on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4. On the other hand, learned APP submitted that if applicant/accused is released on bail, there is possibility of tampering the prosecution evidence. He further submitted that investigation is yet to be completed, therefore, application be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
5. On perusing police papers, prima facie, it reveals that on 08/01/2019, Market Yard Police have carried raid on Panshop of applicant/accused, at that time, applicant/accused was found in possession of Gutka and other contraband articles i.e. tobacco. It 2 appears that as the contraband articles are seized, therefore, custodial interrogation of applicant/accused is not necessary. Therefore, considering all these aspects, in my view if present applicant­ accused is released on bail on certain conditions, no prejudice will be caused to the prosecution. Hence, I pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER i. Application is allowed. ii. The applicant ­accused­ Hemant Kantilal Dodiya be released on bail on furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.25,000/­ (Rupees Twenty five Thousand Only) with one or two solvent sureties in like amount. iii. The applicant­ accused shall not tamper with prosecution evidence. iv. The applicant ­accused shall attend concerned Police Station on every Monday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till filing of the charge­sheet. v. The applicant­ accused shall not leave Pune District without prior permission of this Court, till final disposal of the case. vi. The applicant­ accused shall furnish fresh residential address to concerned Police Station and to this Court in case he changed present address. vii. The applicant ­accused shall attend the court regularly till final disposal of the case. 
---order-ends---
Date : 21/01/2019 (K.D.Vadane) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. 3 “I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Order are same word to word as per original judgment.” Name of Steno : Shri S. B. Gore, Stenographer Grade­I Court Name : K.D. Vadane , Addl. Sessions Judge, Pune Date : 21/01/2019 Order signed by presiding officer on : 21/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 21/01/2019
